page.title: 19BUTTERFLIES IN ELMSTEAD
page.content: Our school is very interested in {conservation}so we planned this year 1985 to release some{White Admiral {Butterflies}into a{large wood}in our area. This wood is an ideal habitat as it has{Wild Honeysuckle}growing in it. There used to be{White Admirals}in the wood now there are none. The{White {Admirals}lay their eggs on{Wild {Honeysuckle.}The butterfly only{lives for{25 days}and in that time it has to mate and lay the eggs. Towards the end August it starts to hibernate by wrapping a leaf of the {Wild Honeysuckle}around itself. It hibernates completely until the following{March}or{April.}It turns into a pupa in{June}then it hatches in about a fortnight. We released{six {White Admirals}into the wood on{19th {June.
